intro: Guatteria recurvisepala, commonly known as the recurved-winged guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, and the plant often grows in humid, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
